Detailed Description

Backdrop that gets drawn behind viewport scenes.

This class encapsulates a 2D image and the parameters for drawing the image as a backdrop for the scene. An instance of this class only contributes to the scene if it is set as the current backdrop for the scene.

See also:
DzScene::setBackdrop(), DzScene::getBackdrop()

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzBackdrop::Rotation

Enumerated image rotation types

DzBackdrop::DzBackdrop ( const DzInFile *  file  )  [protected]

For internal use only.

This constructor is called by the Framework when loading from a file so that certain initializations can be skipped that will happen later in the file load process.

Parameters:
file The file from which this object was loaded.

Member Function Documentation

void DzBackdrop::clear (  )  [virtual, slot]

Clears the current back drop image, and resets all parameters.

Example:
    // get the backdrop for the scene
    DzBackdrop  *backdrop = dzScene->getBackdrop();

    // clear the backdrop
    backdrop->clear();
void DzBackdrop::draw ( const DzDrawStyle &  style,
int  width,
int  height,
const QRect &  view 
) const [virtual]

Draw in the 3D viewport. Derived classes should override this method if they want to be drawn in the 3D viewports. This method should only be called from an OpenGL widget when an OpenGL context is active, otherwise its results are undefined.

Parameters:
style The view style and drawing options for the current drawing pass.
width The width of the viewport.
height The height of the viewport.
view The area to render.
DzBackdrop::drawnDataChanged (  )  [signal]

Emitted when the information in this backdrop changes.

bool DzBackdrop::getFlipHorizontal (  )  const [virtual]
Returns:
Whether or not the backdrop is flipped horizontally.
Example:
    // get the backdrop for the scene
    DzBackdrop  *backdrop = dzScene->getBackdrop();

    // log the current flip state of the backdrop
    if( backdrop->getFlipHorizontal() )
        dzApp->log( "Backdrop is flipped horizontally" );
    else
        dzApp->log( "Backdrop is not flipped horizontally" );
See also:
setFlipHorizontal()
bool DzBackdrop::getFlipVertical (  )  const [virtual]
Returns:
Whether or not the backdrop is flipped vertically.
Example:
    // get the backdrop for the scene
    DzBackdrop  *backdrop = dzScene->getBackdrop();

    // flip the backdrop vertically
    backdrop->setFlipVertical( !backdrop->getFlipVertical() );
See also:
setFlipVertical()
DzBoolProperty * DzBackdrop::getHorizontalFlipControl (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The property that controls whether the backdrop is flipped horizontally
DzMaterial * DzBackdrop::getMaterial (  )  const [virtual, slot]
Returns:
An editable instance of the material used to shade the backdrop.
Example:
    // get the backdrop for the scene
    DzBackdrop  *backdrop = dzScene->getBackdrop();
    DzMaterial  *mat = backdrop->getMaterial();

    // set the color of the backdrop to red
    mat->setDiffuseColor( QColor( 255, 0, 0 ) );
DzBackdrop::Rotation DzBackdrop::getRotation (  )  const [virtual]
Returns:
Current backdrop rotation.
Example:
    // get the backdrop for the scene
    DzBackdrop              *backdrop = dzScene->getBackdrop();
    DzBackdrop::Rotation    rot = backdrop->getRotation();

    // Rotate the image 90 degrees clockwise from its current rotation
    switch( rot ){
    case DzBackdrop::NO_ROTATION:
        backdrop->setRotation( DzBackdrop::ROTATE_RIGHT_90 );
        break;
    case DzBackdrop::ROTATE_LEFT_90:
        backdrop->setRotation( DzBackdrop::NO_ROTATION );
        break;
    case DzBackdrop::ROTATE_RIGHT_90:
        backdrop->setRotation( DzBackdrop::ROTATE_180 );
        break;
    case DzBackdrop::ROTATE_180:
        backdrop->setRotation( DzBackdrop::ROTATE_LEFT_90 );
        break;
    };
See also:
setRotation()
DzEnumProperty * DzBackdrop::getRotationControl (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The property that controls rotation of the backdrop
DzTexture * DzBackdrop::getTexture (  )  const [virtual, slot]
Returns:
Current backdrop image.
Example:
    // get the backdrop for the scene
    DzBackdrop  *backdrop = dzScene->getBackdrop();
    DzTexture   *img = backdrop->getTexture();

    // log the file name of the current backdrop image
    if( img )
        dzApp->log( QString( "Current Backdrop Image: %1" ).arg( img->getFilename() );
    else
        dzApp->log( "No Current Backdrop Image" );
See also:
setImage()
DzBoolProperty * DzBackdrop::getVerticalFlipControl (  )  const [slot]

The property that controls whether the backdrop is flipped vertically

void DzBackdrop::render ( const DzRenderSettings &  settings,
int  width,
int  height 
) const [virtual]

Method called to allow the backdrop to render itself. Backdrops must use an imager shader to draw themselves.

Parameters:
settings The render settings that are being used for the current render pass.
width Image width being rendered to.
height Image height being rendered to.
void DzBackdrop::save ( DzOutFile *  file  )  const [virtual]

Saves backdrop data to the native file format.

Parameters:
file The file to save to.

Reimplemented from DzElement.

void DzBackdrop::setFlipHorizontal ( bool  val  )  [virtual]

Sets whether or not the backdrop image should be flipped horizontally.

Parameters:
val If true, the backdrop will be flipped horizontally.
Example:
    // get the backdrop for the scene
    DzBackdrop  *backdrop = dzScene->getBackdrop();

    // flip the backdrop horizontally
    backdrop->setFlipHorizontal( !backdrop->getFlipHorizontal() );
See also:
getFlipHorizontal()
void DzBackdrop::setFlipVertical ( bool  val  )  [virtual]

Sets whether or not the backdrop image should be flipped vertically.

Parameters:
val If true, the backdrop will be flipped vertically.
Example:
    // get the backdrop for the scene
    DzBackdrop  *backdrop = dzScene->getBackdrop();

    // set the backdrop to be flipped vertically
    backdrop->setFlipHorizontal( true );
See also:
getFlipVertical()

void DzBackdrop::setRotation ( DzBackdrop::Rotation  rot  )  [virtual]

Sets the backdrop rotation.

Parameters:
rot The backdrop rotation value.
Example:
    // get the backdrop for the scene
    DzBackdrop  *backdrop = dzScene->getBackdrop();

    // set the backdrop to be rotated 180 degrees
    backdrop->setRotation( DzBackdrop::ROTATE_180 );
See also:
getRotation()
void DzBackdrop::setTexture ( const DzTexture *  img  )  [virtual, slot]

Sets the backdrop image.

Parameters:
img The backdrop image.
Example:
    // get the backdrop for the scene
    DzBackdrop  *backdrop = dzScene->getBackdrop();
    DzImageMgr  *mgr = dzApp->getImageMgr();

    // set the backdrop image
    backdrop->setImage( mgr->getImage( dzApp->getDocumentsPath() + "/Content/Backdrops/SomeBackdrop.jpg" ) );
See also:
getImage()
void DzBackdrop::showOptions ( QWidget *  parent = NULL  )  [virtual, slot]
Parameters:
parent Parent widget.

Show the options dialog for this backdrop.

Example:
    // get the backdrop for the scene
    DzBackdrop  *backdrop = dzScene->getBackdrop();

    // display options for the backdrop to the user
    backdrop->showOptions( dzApp->getInterface() );
